messages.message:
note: to fully eliminate all discrepancies between doc-based review and run-based review, we need to implement important routing changes on the frontend as part of task-based review

when you click a run id to view that run's results, you should always enter task-based review (see gif)
• currently, this is not the case - clicking the run id enters run-based review, which is confusingly different from doc-based review in many ways (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1f63XUMnQMDaLsfYjV7OGO_2jLNDV8TYihuq73vFgurk/edit?tab=t.0)
• after we have task-based review, we need to make sure that clicking a deployment run's id in the deployments run table always results in the same behavior, regardless of whether the deployment is configured for  "Review by file" or "Review by run"
    ◦ ex: let's say a deployment is configured for "Review by run"
    ◦ for such a deployment's run
        ▪︎ if the user clicks the deployment run id, we should fetch all files in that run -> enter Human Review with these files in `IB_filesInReview` in local storage
        ▪︎ ditto for an email downstream integration that sends an email with a "View run results" button
cc @prateek.tenkale (i already discussed this with you, just sharing with the team more widely)

>  if the user clicks the deployment run id, we should fetch all files in that run -> enter Human Review with these files in `IB_filesInReview` in local storage
how is this different to entering human review with the `jobId` in the URL? (aka entering run based review normally)

we need to eliminate run-based review since if we're in run-based review (ie `jobId` is specified in the URL via query parameter or path parameter), the frontend uses run-based review endpoints
-> this results in confusingly different behavior from doc-based review in many ways (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1f63XUMnQMDaLsfYjV7OGO_2jLNDV8TYihuq73vFgurk/edit?tab=t.0)

my message basically reiterates this section (https://docs.google.com/document/d/13VJ9dg6XIaZHN8eqOrq0nX_eflXe7xnpNdpG2kFBb0Q/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.utcqwyf0xi7y) of Udit's doc
got it, so we’re getting rid of the old run based reviews. hurray :tada:
Yes old human review needs to go!
Doc based review will be replaced with task based review
